name: places/ChIJp-sFzaJZwokRdyaZMsu_DkU
formattedAddress: 48 W 17th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
adrFormatAddress: 48 W 17th St, New York, NY 10011, USA

editorialSummary.text: A semi-secret entrance (ring bell) leads to this plush lounge crafting Prohibition-era cocktails.

originalText.text:
Raines Law Room in Manhattan is like stepping into a secret club from the Roaring Twenties! The entrance, with its hidden doorbell, makes you feel like you're in on something exclusive and cool.

As a person of color, hitting up fancy places in the city can sometimes feel iffy, but Raines Law Room was a breath of fresh air. The staff were incredibly welcoming and friendly, which instantly put me at ease.

Inside, the place is decked out with comfy seats and moody lighting. The snacks they serve are just the right match for their wine selection ( which is limited, but they have amazing cocktails).

Raines Law Room isn't just a bar; it's like time-traveling to a classy, inclusive hangout where you're treated like a VIP. It's an awesome spot in Manhattan that's all about great vibes, good drinks, and making everyone feel at home. Shout out to the host V for good vibes and good energy!!

originalText.text:
Jesus Christ. What a disappointment this place was. After 30min waiting for the drinks, they served the worst drinks we ever had - look at the pictures. They put a raspberry with obvious MOLD on our cocktail. And the other cocktail looks like a $5 dorm cocktail with a soggy lychee. And those cocktails cost >$20…:-)
The server was borderline rude and not helpful. You have to press a button to request service - nobody reacted to our button for 10min. Being confronted, the server had the audacity to act like this is all good and didn’t know why I complained.
The inside room is mainly for big groups and they don’t allow couples to sit there even if it wouldn’t interferes with reservations (?). Instead they seat all couples in the “secret garden” which is ridiculously ugly and uncozy. Really unpleasant feeling there. Another couple who arrived after us just stood up and left after 2 min (we should have done the same)

How is this place still open and people give it good reviews? So many things wrong here - I can’t imagine my experience was an exception.

originalText.text:
A very special place. When they open the door its like a magic. Very unique atmosphere.
Don't expect to eat, only very good cocktails and a good service.

text.text:

Don't expect to eat, only very good cocktails and a good service.

originalText.text:
The perfect NY speakeasy experience, this bar is a must visit! To enter you ring a bell on your way down to the bottom floor of an unmarked building. Inside, the room is a cozy quiet vibe with mood lighting and plenty of comfy seating for groups.

Every cocktail we tried was just as tasty as the last. The selection of unique drinks is pretty extensive and the bartenders are happy to make custom ones as well. All in all, one of the better NY bars I’ve been to.

text.text:
The perfect NY speakeasy experience, this bar is a must visit! To enter you ring a bell on your way down to the bottom floor of an unmarked building. Inside, the room is a cozy quiet vibe with mood lighting and plenty of comfy seating for groups.

Every cocktail we tried was just as tasty as the last. The selection of unique drinks is pretty extensive and the bartenders are happy to make custom ones as well. All in all, one of the better NY bars I’ve been to.

originalText.text: Drinks were on point. My wife's whiskey business was great and my libertador was interesting and complex. At first sip I wasn't sure if I'd like it but after the 2nd and 3rd,it definitely grew on me. Not much of a selection for food obviously since it's a cocktail bar but the small tray of cheese, crackers, olives, and sopresetta were ok to munch on. In regards to ambiance and atmosphere, wasn't really impressed. It was just super dark with really dim lighting. Granted I know they're trying to set a vibe, but I've been to other cocktail bars with a   similar setting but a lot more nicer. Granted I don't know what the secret garden is like so I would probably come back one more time to check it out. Overall not a bad place for a date or just to catch up with friends with a nice drinks
